revisions.rev:
{{Use British English|date=November 2010}} This article is a [[discography]] of releases by '''[[Apple Records]]''', a [[record label]] formed by [[The Beatles]] in 1968. During its early years, the label enjoyed a fair degree of commercial success, most notably with [[Mary Hopkin]] and [[Badfinger]], as well as discovering acts such as [[James Taylor]] who would go on to greater success with other labels. However, by the mid 1970s, Apple had become little more than an outlet for the Beatles' solo recordings (although, as the solo Beatles were actually still under contract to [[EMI]], the Apple label was, in truth, only a cosmetic addition to their releases). After EMI's contract with the Beatles ended in 1976 the Apple label was finally wound up. The label was reactivated in the 1990s with many of the original Apple albums being re-issued on [[compact disc]] and the company now oversees new Beatles releases such as the ''[[Beatles Anthology|Anthology]]'' and ''[[The Beatles 1|1]]'' albums as well as the 2009 Beatles remastering programme. In 2010, Apple set about remastering and reissuing its back catalogue for a second time. For convenience, releases are divided into [[United Kingdom|UK]] and [[United States of America|US]] releases. However, some releases which were designated a UK-sequence catalogue number were only issued in certain mainland [[Europe]]an countries. Additionally, with the Beatles still being under contract to EMI, all of the group's records (and the majority of their UK solo releases) retained the numbering systems of [[Parlophone]] (for the UK, New Zealand and South Africa), [[Capitol Records|Capitol]] (for the US) and EMI (for Australia). A special recorded "message" medley from Frank Sinatra to [[Maureen Starkey]]. One single-sided single pressed and the master tape has been destroyed.
{{note label|2|2|2}} Early UK editions credited to 'White Trash'.
{{note label|3|3|3}} Only released in Italy - 17.01.69.
{{note label|4|4|4}} Not given a full release, as EMI would not distribute. Only 2000 copies were pressed in the UK. An unnumbered US Apple acetate also exists.
{{note label|5|5|5}} Only released in France - 07.03.69.
{{note label|6|6|6}} Only released in Europe and Japan - 18.07.69.
{{note label|7|7|7}} Mail order only EP featuring: The Iveys "Storm In A Teacup" / James Taylor "Something's Wrong" / Jackie Lomax "Little Yellow Pill" / Mary Hopkin "Pebble And The Man".
{{note label|8|8|8}} Not issued. Planned release date - 19.09.69. APPLE 16 was also allocated to Mortimer's unreleased recording of "[[Two of Us (The Beatles song)|On Our Way Home]]".
{{note label|9|9|9}} Not issued. Planned release date - 05.12.69.
{{note label|10|10|10}} Not issued in UK. Issued as APPLE 28 in some European countries.
{{note label|11|11|11}} Issued as APPLE 27 in some European countries.
{{note label|12|12|12}} Not issued.
{{note label|13|13|13}} Not issued in UK.
{{note label|14|14|14}} Cancelled release. Made it only to the acetate stage. B-side unknown.
{{note label|15|15|15}} Re-issued with "Let Me Roll It" as the B side on 18.02.74.
{{note label|16|16|16}} Re-issued on 07.02.75 (UK) and 20.02.75 (US) with the same catalogue numbers but with the A and B sides reversed.
{{note label|17|17|17}} Released as part of a series of EMI "Golden 45's".
{{note label|18|18|18}} Four track EP featuring: Mary Hopkin "Those Were The Days" / Billy Preston "That's The Way God Planned It" / Jackie Lomax "Sour Milk Sea" / Badfinger "Come And Get It".
{{note label|19|19|19}} Re-issued from 1975 with the same catalogue number (and sometimes artwork) on Capitol after McCartney's contract moved from Parlophone.
{{note label|20|20|20}} Re-issued with the same catalogue number on the Parlophone label.
{{note label|37|37|37}} Originally issued on Parlophone.
{{note label|38|38|38}} Double A Side.
{{note label|39|39|39}} Released on Parlophone before the establishment of Apple Records (New Zealand).
{{note label|40|40|40}} Originally released on green vinyl and reissued on black vinyl.
{{note label|41|41|41}} Some issues list "McCartney's Wings".
{{note label|42|42|42}} Released as a 7" 45rpm. and a 10" 78rpm.
{{note label|44|44|44}} Demo copies have the tracks "Band On The Run" (Edited Version) / "Band On The Run" (Full Version).
{{note label|45|45|45}} Also released as a double A side and with reversed A and B side.
{{note label|46|46|46}} Released in "East Asia" (Hong Kong) by Parlophone, Catalogue number PEA-501.
{{note label|47|47|47}} Released in "East Asia" (Hong Kong) by Parlophone, Catalogue number PEA-502.
{{note label|48|48|48}} Due to extreme demands on production, EMI also contracted [[Decca Records|Decca]] and [[Philips]] to press this release.
{{note label|49|49|49}} Due to extreme demands on production, EMI also contracted Philips to press this release.
{{note label|50|50|50}} Due to industrial action, EMI also contracted Decca to press this release.

Planned release date - 30.05.69. Later issued on [[Elektra Records]] as ''[[Accept No Substitute]]'' (promo copies of Elektra release have SAPCOR 7 matrix numbers in inner groove crossed out). SAPCOR 7 was also earmarked for a 20.06.69 album release by Trash.
{{note label|22|22|22}} Only released in Germany, Italy and Japan (with alternate catalogue numbers) - 04.07.69.
{{note label|23|23|23}} Regular album release to replace the Box Set package which accompanied the original UK issue.
{{note label|24|24|24}} ''From Then To You'' and ''The Beatles Christmas Album'' are the same album, being a collection of the Beatles Fan Club-only Christmas [[Flexi disc|flexi discs]] issued between 1963 and 1969. Similarly, these two albums were only available to members of "The Beatles Fan Club".
{{note label|25|25|25}} Only issued in mono despite stereo 'SW' prefix on US release. This album had previously been issued in full on Philles Records in the US and has since been reissued many times on various labels.
{{note label|26|26|26}} Released in Brazil in mono without the 'S' prefix.
{{note label|27|27|27}} Planned for release in Brazil in mono without the 'S' prefix but only released in stereo.
{{note label|30|30|30}} Reissued on vinyl 10.12.96 with "Do You Mind" bonus track. Released in New Zealand as SAPCOR 101.
{{note label|31|31|31}} This album has since been reissued on various labels.
{{note label|32|32|32}} This album was reissued in 1977 on Ring O'Records, Catalogue number 2320 104, with different artwork.
{{note label|33|33|33}} [[Tetragrammaton Records]] catalogue number as Capitol refused to distribute.
{{note label|34|34|34}} Later re-issued on EMI's "Music For Pleasure" label in the UK with a different catalogue number.
{{note label|35|35|35}} Later re-issued on EMI's "Fame" label in the UK with a different catalogue number.
{{note label|36|36|36}} Originally planned for release as STAP-01.
{{note label|43|43|43}} Pressed in the UK for export only, not released in the UK.

Released in the US by [[Harvest Records]] in 1971 (Catalogue number ST-424) and on CD by EMI in 2005 (Catalogue number CCM-540-2). ==Reissues== ===1990s remasters=== Apple began the process of reissuing the back catalogue on compact disc in 1991, with many of the CDs containing bonus tracks. By this time, the releases in the UK and US were virtually identical. This list does not include Beatles or solo albums which were re-released on compact disc by Parlophone or Capitol. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left;" ! width="100"|'''Catalogue No.''' ! width="250"|'''Artist''' ! A worldwide release date of 9 September 2009 (09.09.09) was set to tie in with the release of [[The Beatles: Rock Band]] [[music video game]]. Replacing the CD editions which had been issued in 1987, all of the original Beatles albums were reissued in new packaging with mini [[DVD]] documentaries and, unlike the 1987 issues, the first four albums (''[[Please Please Me]]'', ''[[With The Beatles]]'', ''[[A Hard Day's Night (album)|A Hard Day's Night]]'' and ''[[Beatles For Sale]]'') were made available on CD in stereo for the first time. Also, the ''[[Past Masters]]'' collection of non-album material was now issued as a double CD set, as opposed to the two separate discs issued in 1987. In addition, two box sets were issued, one containing all 16 remastered stereo albums and a second limited edition box set containing the mono mixes of all the albums up to and including ''[[The Beatles (album)|The Beatles]]'' (the later albums did not receive a separate mono mix). In late 2010, the compilation albums ''[[1962â1966]]'' and ''[[1967â1970]]'' were issued again and, shortly afterwards, the entire remastered catalogue was finally made available to [[music download|download]] on [[iTunes]] after years of legal wrangling between the Beatles and [[Apple Inc.]] {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left;" ! width="100"|'''Catalogue No.''' ! width="250"|'''Artist''' ! width="400"|'''Title''' ! width="55"|'''Release Date''' |- |2438072 |The Beatles |''[[Past Masters]]'' |align=center|09.09.09 |- |3824132 |The Beatles |''[[A Hard Day's Night (album)|A Hard Day's Night]]'' |align=center|09.09.09 |- |3824142 |The Beatles |''[[Beatles for Sale]]'' |align=center|09.09.09 |- |3824152 |The Beatles |''[[Help! Issued 07.12.09. ===2010 remasters=== With the 1990s reissues out of print, many of the original Apple albums were re-released for a second time in new remastered versions in October 2010. These remasters were also made available on iTunes, just a few weeks before the Beatles back catalogue was finally released for download. Several of the iTunes versions included exclusive tracks not available on the standard CD issue, although these tracks were included on a bonus double CD as part of the ''Apple Box Set'', which collected all of the remastered albums in one package. All of the 2010 remasters had been previously issued in the 1990s reissue programme apart from a 21-track compilation entitled '' [[Come and Get It: The Best of Apple Records]] '' which included a number of single-only tracks which now received their first official release on compact disc. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left;" ! width="100"|'''Catalogue No.''' ! width="250"|'''Artist''' ! width="400"|'''Title''' ! width="55"|'''Release Date''' |- |6424382 |Badfinger |''Magic Christian Music'' |align=center|25.10.10 |- |6424392 |Badfinger |''Ass'' |align=center|25.10.10 |- |6424402 |Badfinger |''Straight Up'' |align=center|25.10.10 |- |6463972 |Various Artists |''Come And Get It -
